job.title: Post-doctoral researcher in computational biology, working on protein sequence data (W/M)

company.name: EPFL - Ecole Polytechnique Fédérale de Lausanne

job.plaincontent:
The Ecole polytechnique fédérale de Lausanne (EPFL) is one of the most dynamic university campuses in Europe and ranks among the top 20 universities worldwide. The EPFL employs 6,000 people supporting the three main missions of the institutions: education, research and innovation. The EPFL campus offers an exceptional working environment at the heart of a community of 16,000 people, including over 10,000 students and 3,500 researchers from 120 different countries.
Post-doctoral researcher in computational biology, working on protein sequence data (W/M)
Your mission : Applications are invited to fill an ERC-funded post-doctoral position about “Sequence-function relationship in proteins” at EPFL, in the new group of Prof. Anne-Florence Bitbol.
Proteins play crucial roles in our cells. The amino-acid sequence of a protein encodes its function, including its structure and its possible interactions. In evolution, random mutations affect the sequence, while natural selection acts at the level of function. Shedding light on the sequence-function mapping of proteins is central to a systems-level understanding of cells, and has far-reaching applications in synthetic biology and drug targeting. The current explosion of available sequence data enables data- driven approaches to discover the principles of protein operation.
In alignments of homologous protein sequences, correlations exist between certain amino-acid sites. We aim to establish a full decomposition of these correlations, dissecting signatures from functional optimization, and from evolutionary history. We also aim to make new predictions for protein-protein interactions from sequence data, and to understand whether real proteins are mechanically optimized Main duties and responsibilities include :
- Developing and applying computational methods to understand the sequence-function relationship in proteins. - Curating protein sequence data. - Presenting and writing up results. - Possibly: participating in advising students working on related topics.
Your profile :
- PhD in a relevant field, e.g. computational biology, biophysics. - Strong quantitative background. - Taste for working extensively with biological data. - Independence and self-motivation. - Expertise in one or several of the following fields will be highly considered: bioinformatics, use of sequence databases, sequence data analysis, applications of inference methods or information theory to biological data.
We offer :
- Excellent working conditions and competitive remuneration. - A multi-disciplinary, multi-cultural and stimulating environment.
Start date : From March 1st, 2020 Term of employment : Fixed-term (CDD) Duration : 1 year, renewable Contact : Please send your application (cover letter, detailed resume and copies of certificates) by e-mail to anne-florence.bitbol@epfl.ch

job.title: Senior Lab Technician (W/M)

company.name: EPFL - Ecole Polytechnique Fédérale de Lausanne

job.plaincontent:
The Ecole polytechnique fédérale de Lausanne (EPFL) is one of the most dynamic university campuses in Europe and ranks among the top 20 universities worldwide. The EPFL employs 6,000 people supporting the three main missions of the institutions: education, research and innovation. The EPFL campus offers an exceptional working environment at the heart of a community of 16,000 people, including over 10,000 students and 3,500 researchers from 120 different countries.
Senior Lab Technician (W/M)
Your mission : The EPFL Blue Brain Project (BBP), situated on the Campus Biotech in Geneva, Switzerland, applies advanced neuroinformatics, data analytics, high-performance computing and simulation-based approaches to the challenge of understanding the structure and function of the mammalian brain in health and disease. The BBP provides the community with regular releases of data, models and tools to accelerate neuroscience discovery and clinical translation through open science and global collaboration. The Membrane Systems Groups in the Blue Brain Project has an open position for a Senior Lab Technician (W/M). Main duties and responsibilities include : We are systematically characterizing the kinetic properties of all ion channels known to be expressed in the mammalian brain. We have developed a standard workflow to perform automated electrophysiology on cell lines over-expressing ion channels. The candidate would be working on molecular biology, cell culture and automated electrophysiology. It is also expected from candidate to coordinate tasks between other technicians, maintain documentation and provide regular reporting to his/her supervisor. Your profile :
- Research Technician degree (CFC) or equivalent expertise (Master’s degree in Life Science) - Strong experience in molecular biology and cell culture methods. - At least 5 years of experience as laboratory techniques in research - Experience in project and people coordination is needed - Experience or background in electrophysiology will be a plus - The candidate should be open to learn or develop new techniques, protocols or to operate new equipment - Well organized, clean documentation, highly motivated and team player
We offer :
- A world-recognized leader in simulation-based research in neuroscience - A dynamic, multidisciplinary, international and collaborative working environment committed to benefitting the global community - A modern working environment, based at the Biotech Campus in Geneva Sécheron
Start date : As soon as possible Term of employment : Fixed-term (CDD) Duration : 1 year, renewable Remark : Only candidates who applied through EPFL website or our partner Jobup’s website will be considered.apply online

job.title: Data Science Course Developer and Instructor - Python/Machine Learning - EPFL Extension School

company.name: EPFL - Ecole Polytechnique Fédérale de Lausanne

job.htmlcontent:
The Ecole polytechnique fédérale de Lausanne (EPFL) is one of the most dynamic university campuses in Europe and ranks among the top 20 universities worldwide. The EPFL employs 6,000 people supporting the three main missions of the institutions: education, research and innovation. The EPFL campus offers an exceptional working environment at the heart of a community of 16,000 people, including over 10,000 students and 3,500 researchers from 120 different countries.

Data Science Course Developer and Instructor - Python/Machine Learning - EPFL Extension School

Your mission :
The EPFL Extension School is growing rapidly and we're looking for Data Science Course Developers and Instructors to join our Data Science/Machine Learning team in 2020!Here’s what you’ll get to do in this role:
  • Develop data science and advanced analytics activities, including applications of mathematical modeling, statistical analysis and machine learning techniques (through exercises, public posts, capstone project guidance);
  • Guide learners in acquiring hands-on data science experience using Python (NumPy, Pandas, Scipy, Scikit-Learn, Matplotlib, Seaborn);
  • Apply technical expertise and leadership skills to design, develop, manage and grade learner projects using real-world large datasets and relational databases;
  • Design and lead workshops and hackathons, and participate in conferences to promote the EPFL Extension School, data science and digital skills to a wide audience;
  • Collaborate with partners from academia and the private sector to identify opportunities for development of new courses and workshops as well as learner course projects and capstone projects;
  • Manage additional course development and other activities to support the growth of the EPFL Extension School
The audience for the EPFL Extension School courses extends to a large, general public and the knowledge level of the learners will range from novice (no prior experience with Python and/or in data science) to intermediate (strong familiarity, possibly but not necessarily university or post-graduate level knowledge of either math or programming) to advanced (data science/machine learning practitioners in the field, seeking to learn specific skills). The course developer should be able to adapt his/her approach and output accordingly. Requirements :
We expect a solid, demonstrable and practical background in all domains of data science relevant to beginner- and intermediate-level learners. In particular, we expect you to be have extensive hands-on experience with the most common tools, methods, and applications of all stages of the data science pipeline (i.e. data mining, data cleaning, data analysis, data visualisation), using Python. You will have advanced knowledge of Python and all relevant data science libraries. You will also have a proven ability to explain basic and difficult concepts in data/data science clearly and effectively to a wide audience.The ideal candidate also has experience with a variety of methods / models / tools relevant to data analytics, statistics and/or machine learning. Additional required qualifications:
  • Background in computer science, data science, statistics, the physical sciences or other quantitative field (academic or equivalent professional experience);
  • Previous experience with data science projects;
  • Previous teaching/TA experience;
  • Excellent communications and relationship management / « people » skills;
  • Excellent written verbal presentation skills and the ability to communicate both to business and technical audiences, with a wide variety of skills / skill levels;
  • Strong organisational skills;
  • Good team player;
  • Self-starter, capable of autonomous time management and work;
  • Ability to rapidly and independently acquire new skills
  • Fluent English, both written and spoken;
  • Comfortable with developer tools: git, the command line, code editors, etc.;
  • Previous experience in time series analysis, natural language processing, or advanced statistics a plus;
  • Start-up experience a plus.
Start date :
As soon as possible Duration :
1 year Term of employment :
Fixed-term (CDD) Work rate :
100%Contact :
Please apply through the following link only: http://bit.do/DSCDCI

job.title: JavaScript Frontend Software Engineer for Scientific Visualization (W/M)

company.name: EPFL - Ecole Polytechnique Fédérale de Lausanne

job.plaincontent:
The Ecole polytechnique fédérale de Lausanne (EPFL) is one of the most dynamic university campuses in Europe and ranks among the top 20 universities worldwide. The EPFL employs 6,000 people supporting the three main missions of the institutions: education, research and innovation. The EPFL campus offers an exceptional working environment at the heart of a community of 16,000 people, including over 10,000 students and 3,500 researchers from 120 different countries.
JavaScript Frontend Software Engineer for Scientific Visualization (W/M)
Your mission : The EPFL Blue Brain Project (BBP), situated on the Campus Biotech in Geneva, Switzerland, applies advanced neuroinformatics, data analytics, high-performance computing and simulation-based approaches to the challenge of understanding the structure and function of the mammalian brain in health and disease. The BBP provides the community with regular releases of data, models and tools to accelerate neuroscience discovery and clinical translation through open science and global collaboration. The aim of the Blue Brain Project is to build accurate, biologically detailed, digital reconstructions, and simulations of the rodent brain. In order to be able to inspect, explore and validate our models, scientific visualization plays a very important role. The capability to visualize atlas-based data, explore models, and image our simulations at scale and with interactivity represents the equivalent of a microscope or telescope in a regular physical environment. In a project where the majority of our science is happening within the computer, scientific visualization is our window thereto.
You would be joining the Scientific Visualization section of the Blue Brain Project, which is in charge of developing different visualization platforms that give scientists the capability to create visual contents of their brain reconstructions and simulations. As a team member, you will be working close to scientific visualization researchers, rendering specialists, software engineers and scientific media designers Main duties and responsibilities include :
- Participate in the design, implementation and maintenance of a modern web interface for Brayns. Brayns is our open source scalable scientific visualization framework for brain models based on ray tracing. It features high fidelity, large-scale, interactivity, and stereoscopic rendering capabilities. - Innovate in user interfaces that makes interactive scientific visualization accessible to researchers in the web browser and in immersive environments - Interact with scientific and engineering teams for visualization use cases, requirements and specifications
Your profile : Essential skills and experience required:
- Expertise in modern JavaScript and Typescript - Good familiarity with UNIX/Linux operating systems - Experience with version control and workflows with Git - Solid HTML and CSS 3 knowledge - Experience with React library - Well-versed in the modern JavaScript ecosystem: node, npm, yarn, …
Preferred:
- Strong interest in computer graphics - Good knowledge of asynchronous programming - Experience with scientific visualization or Python is a plus
Profile:
- Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in computer science or similar field - 2+ year of work experience with frontend web development (JavaScript) - Experience with driving the design and maintenance of complex software projects - Comfortable with large, existing codebases - Good team player and fluent English in speech and writing
We offer :
- A world-recognized leader in simulation-based research in neuroscience - A dynamic, multidisciplinary, international and collaborative working environment committed to benefitting the global community - A modern working environment, based at the Biotech Campus in Geneva Sécheron
Start date : As soon as possible Term of employment : Fixed-term (CDD) Duration : 1 year, renewable Remark : Only candidates who applied through EPFL website or our partner Jobup’s website will be considered.apply online

job.title: Senior Software Engineer - Collaboratory Product Owner (W/M)

company.name: EPFL - Ecole Polytechnique Fédérale de Lausanne

job.plaincontent:
The Ecole polytechnique fédérale de Lausanne (EPFL) is one of the most dynamic university campuses in Europe and ranks among the top 20 universities worldwide. The EPFL employs 6,000 people supporting the three main missions of the institutions: education, research and innovation. The EPFL campus offers an exceptional working environment at the heart of a community of 16,000 people, including over 10,000 students and 3,500 researchers from 120 different countries.
Senior Software Engineer – Collaboratory Product Owner (W/M)
Your mission : The Project Coordination Office (PCO) of the Human Brain Project (HBP) at EPFL, situated at the Campus Biotech in Geneva, Switzerland is looking to strengthen its Infrastructure team with an experienced: Senior Software Engineer – Collaboratory Product Owner (W/M)
This position plays a leadership role in the development of HBP neuroinformatics platform, contributing architectural and software development expertise.The parts of the platform being developed at the PCO include:
- Web-based collaboration tools
ohttps://www.youtube.com/channel/UCvE4Ndn2rXfgNZYOdnEPYww
- Web interfaces to allow scientists to upload, annotate and visualize a diverse array of neuroscience data uploaded to the neuroinformatics platform.
ohttps://www.humanbrainproject.eu/en/explore-the-brain/search
- Rich web clients and web services for high-resolution brain atlasing - Intuitive web interfaces and web services for searching a diverse array of neuroscience data types produced by the HBP platforms:
o Neuroinformatics o Brain Simulation o High Performance Analytics and Computing o Medical Informatics o Neuromorphic computing o Neurorobotics The HBP is building a world-class infrastructure to enable open science research with the goal of substantially improving health care for brain-related diseases ranging from migraines to dementia. You can get an overview of the EBRAINS research infrastructure being developed by HBP from the following video:
EBRAINS - A platform for collaboration in digital neuroscience https://youtu.be/1FxeWaPM6RQ (20’) Main duties and responsibilities include :
- Gathering input from diverse stakeholders and synthesis of that input into a cohesive, defensible feature prioritization - Leadership role in architecture and development of the HBP Collaboratory, a keystone of the neuroinformatics platform in the EBRAINS research infrastructure being deployed by HBP, including:
o Central user authentication and authorization in collaboration with single sign-on solutions from project partners o Wiki solution for collaborative documentation, supporting extension for additional web apps o Central file repository on the platform’s cloud o Solution for the execution of live code o Multi-user collaborative office suite solution o Group management for the implementation of group workspaces
- Participation in the UI and UX design process - Design, architecture and development of web APIs - Integration with various backend services and tools - Evaluation, customization and integration of 3rd party open source services into the HBP Collaboratory - All aspects of the modern software development lifecycle: unit testing, continuous integration, version control, debugging, documentation and direct user support - Regular, direct interaction with scientific customers - Support the development team of the neuroinformatics platform in the development of other tools including:
o interactive web applications to enable delivery of HBP 2D and 3D brain atlases, o intuitive search functionality for diverse neuroscientific metadata, o a central project management dashboard for the entire HBP project, o other neuroinformatics platform tools developed on other sites.
Essential skills and experience :
- A strong development background: frontend, backend or full-stack - Web service API development. Proven ability to iteratively develop and deploy user relevant features to production applications - Experience in applying Agile methodologies - Good team player and fluent written and spoken English
Desirable (but not required) :
- Jupyter notebooks - Client-side testing frameworks (Selenium or comparable) - DevOps or SaaS environment experience - Production experience with Java and/or Python - Database expertise, SQL and/or NoSQL - Data visualization, WebGL or game development experience
Your profile :
- Minimum of 7 years of experience and successful development track record for collaborative software projects
We offer : What is HBP? The Human Brain Project is a European Flagship project with 130+ leading universities and research institutes in 24 countries around the world. The goal of the project is to better understand the human brain by accelerating large-scale collaborative neuroscience across a wide range of disciplines. As part of the work needed to accomplish this goal, we are building a neuroscientific research infrastructure to enable strategic scientific use-cases. Why work in the HBP-PCO infrastructure team? Understanding the human brain is one of the greatest challenges facing 21st century science. Joining the HBP-PCO will put you at the centre of an effort to gain profound insights into what makes us human, develop new treatments for brain disease and build revolutionary new computing technologies. The infrastructure team in the HBP-PCO plays a central role in the larger HBP platform effort to build solid scientific software tools and services. You will find yourself inspired by the exciting things that people around you are building and make a meaningful contribution to understanding the brain. We strive to find the right people and to keep our skills and insights sharp. We are a young, dynamic, interdisciplinary and international team. We focus on delivering high value to the scientific community and are involved in everything from community engagement to integrating scientific workflows with some of the world’s largest supercomputers. Work in the team involves open feedback, with opportunities for additional training to improve our skills. The HBP-PCO is a family friendly, equal opportunity employer (https://equality.epfl.ch/) made up of approximately 40% women. We value diversity and explicitly encourage applications from women. Our offices benefit from a modern working environment based in Biotech Campus, 200 meters from the shore of Lake Geneva (Lac Léman), in one of the best cities to live in the world, with on-site kindergarten. You will be in the centre of Europe with easy access by rail and Geneva airport to all that Europe has to offer. Join us and make an important contribution to the success of one of the most exciting projects of the 21st century! Start date : As soon as possible Term of employment : Fixed-term (CDD) Duration : 1 year, renewableContact : For additional information, please contact Alicia Debayle by e-mail alicia.debayle@epfl.ch Remark : Only candidates who applied through EPFL website or our partner Jobup’s website will be considered.apply online

The EPFL employs 6,000 people supporting the three main missions of the institutions: education, research and innovation. The EPFL campus offers an exceptional working environment at the heart of a community of 16,000 people, including over 10,000 students and 3,500 researchers from 120 different countries.

Senior Software Engineer – Collaboratory Product Owner (W/M)

Your mission :
The Project Coordination Office (PCO) of the Human Brain Project (HBP) at EPFL, situated at the Campus Biotech in Geneva, Switzerland is looking to strengthen its Infrastructure team with an experienced: Senior Software Engineer – Collaboratory Product Owner (W/M)

This position plays a leadership role in the development of HBP neuroinformatics platform, contributing architectural and software development expertise.The parts of the platform being developed at the PCO include:
  • Web-based collaboration tools
ohttps://www.youtube.com/channel/UCvE4Ndn2rXfgNZYOdnEPYww

  • Intuitive web interfaces and web services for searching a diverse array of neuroscience data types produced by the HBP platforms:
o Neuroinformatics
o Brain Simulation
o High Performance Analytics and Computing
o Medical Informatics
o Neuromorphic computing
o Neurorobotics
The HBP is building a world-class infrastructure to enable open science research with the goal of substantially improving health care for brain-related diseases ranging from migraines to dementia.
You can get an overview of the EBRAINS research infrastructure being developed by HBP from the following video:

EBRAINS - A platform for collaboration in digital neuroscience https://youtu.be/1FxeWaPM6RQ (20’) Main duties and responsibilities include :
  • Gathering input from diverse stakeholders and synthesis of that input into a cohesive, defensible feature prioritization
  • Leadership role in architecture and development of the HBP Collaboratory, a keystone of the neuroinformatics platform in the EBRAINS research infrastructure being deployed by HBP, including:
o Central user authentication and authorization in collaboration with single sign-on solutions from project partners
o Wiki solution for collaborative documentation, supporting extension for additional web apps

o Multi-user collaborative office suite solution

  • Participation in the UI and UX design process

o interactive web applications to enable delivery of HBP 2D and 3D brain atlases,
o intuitive search functionality for diverse neuroscientific metadata,
o a central project management dashboard for the entire HBP project,
o other neuroinformatics platform tools developed on other sites.

Essential skills and experience:
  • A strong development background: frontend, backend or full-stack
  • Web service API development. Proven ability to iteratively develop and deploy user relevant features to production applications
  • Experience in applying Agile methodologies
  • Good team player and fluent written and spoken English
Desirable (but not required):
  • Jupyter notebooks
  • Client-side testing frameworks (Selenium or comparable)
  • DevOps or SaaS environment experience
  • Production experience with Java and/or Python
  • Database expertise, SQL and/or NoSQL
  • Data visualization, WebGL or game development experience
Your profile :
  • Minimum of 7 years of experience and successful development track record for collaborative software projects
We offer :
What is HBP?
The Human Brain Project is a European Flagship project with 130+ leading universities and research institutes in 24 countries around the world. The goal of the project is to better understand the human brain by accelerating large-scale collaborative neuroscience across a wide range of disciplines. As part of the work needed to accomplish this goal, we are building a neuroscientific research infrastructure to enable strategic scientific use-cases.
Why work in the HBP-PCO infrastructure team?
Understanding the human brain is one of the greatest challenges facing 21st century science. Joining the HBP-PCO will put you at the centre of an effort to gain profound insights into what makes us human, develop new treatments for brain disease and build revolutionary new computing technologies.
The infrastructure team in the HBP-PCO plays a central role in the larger HBP platform effort to build solid scientific software tools and services. You will find yourself inspired by the exciting things that people around you are building and make a meaningful contribution to understanding the brain.
We strive to find the right people and to keep our skills and insights sharp. We are a young, dynamic, interdisciplinary and international team. We focus on delivering high value to the scientific community and are involved in everything from community engagement to integrating scientific workflows with some of the world’s largest supercomputers. Work in the team involves open feedback, with opportunities for additional training to improve our skills.
The HBP-PCO is a family friendly, equal opportunity employer (https://equality.epfl.ch/) made up of approximately 40% women. We value diversity and explicitly encourage applications from women.
Our offices benefit from a modern working environment based in Biotech Campus, 200 meters from the shore of Lake Geneva (Lac Léman), in one of the best cities to live in the world, with on-site kindergarten. You will be in the centre of Europe with easy access by rail and Geneva airport to all that Europe has to offer.
Join us and make an important contribution to the success of one of the most exciting projects of the 21st century! Start date :

job.title: Web Portal Product Owner (W/M)

company.name: EPFL - Ecole Polytechnique Fédérale de Lausanne

job.plaincontent:
The Ecole polytechnique fédérale de Lausanne (EPFL) is one of the most dynamic university campuses in Europe and ranks among the top 20 universities worldwide. The EPFL employs 6,000 people supporting the three main missions of the institutions: education, research and innovation. The EPFL campus offers an exceptional working environment at the heart of a community of 16,000 people, including over 10,000 students and 3,500 researchers from 120 different countries.
Web Portal Product Owner (W/M)
Your mission : The EPFL Blue Brain Project (BBP), situated on the Campus Biotech in Geneva, Switzerland, applies advanced neuroinformatics, data analytics, high-performance computing and simulation-based approaches to the challenge of understanding the structure and function of the mammalian brain in health and disease. The BBP provides the community with regular releases of data, models and tools to accelerate neuroscience discovery and clinical translation through open science and global collaboration. The BBP disseminates their scientific results through scientific publications (e.g. Markram et al. 2015, Cell) in combination with impactful web portals (e.g. NMC Portal). In order to plan, design, build, launch and maintain our portfolio of web portals, you would be joining the Neuroinformatics Software Engineering team, as Web Portal Product Owner (W/M) . Role & Responsibilities :
- Collaborate with stakeholders and teams to understand business needs and strategies, - Take ownership of product vision and roadmap, - Represent the customers and their requirements, - Define the products’ functionalities and organise them into a product backlog (incl. user stories with acceptance criteria), - Develop technical specifications and oversee development stages, - Work on a day-to-day basis with the engineering team(s), - Inspect and evaluate product progress at each iteration, - Organize quality control and documentation of the product, - Develop and maintain effective relations with web agencies and coordinate the work with contractors when internal resources are insufficient (e.g. front end engineers, UX/UI designers).
Your profile : Required
- Strong interpersonal skills, - Excellent teamwork skills, - Great communication (both verbal and written), presentation and leadership skills, - Sharp analytical and problem-solving skills, - High attention to details, - Planning and organizing in an Agile context, - Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment with changing requirements.
Profile
- At least 3 years experience in information technology, as a product owner, business analyst or software development.
We offer :
- An internationally visible and rising project in simulation-based research in neuroscience using supercomputers, - A young, fun, dynamic, exceptionally inter-disciplinary, and international working environment, - A beautiful working environment, based at Campus Biotech near the lakeside in Geneva, - Opportunities for skill development through training and conferences.
Start date : As soon as possible Term of employment : Fixed-term (CDD) Duration : 1 year, renewable Remark : Only candidates who applied through EPFL website or our partner Jobup’s website will be considered.apply online

job.title: Senior Systems Engineer (W/M)

company.name: EPFL - Ecole Polytechnique Fédérale de Lausanne

job.plaincontent:
The Ecole polytechnique fédérale de Lausanne (EPFL) is one of the most dynamic university campuses in Europe and ranks among the top 20 universities worldwide. The EPFL employs 6,000 people supporting the three main missions of the institutions: education, research and innovation. The EPFL campus offers an exceptional working environment at the heart of a community of 16,000 people, including over 10,000 students and 3,500 researchers from 120 different countries.
Senior Systems Engineer (W/M)
Your mission : The EPFL Blue Brain Project (BBP), situated on the Campus Biotech in Geneva, Switzerland, applies advanced neuroinformatics, data analytics, high-performance computing and simulation-based approaches to the challenge of understanding the structure and function of the mammalian brain in health and disease. The BBP provides the community with regular releases of data, models and tools to accelerate neuroscience discovery and clinical translation through open science and global collaboration. We are now looking for an experienced Senior Systems Engineer (W/M) to build and run BBP’s IT infrastructure. Main duties and responsibilities include : We offer you an opportunity to work with a wide variety of technologies, such as:
- A state-of-the-art HPC cluster with 1200+ nodes - OpenStack, OpenShift & VMware - Spectrum Scale (8PB), TSM, NetApp & CEPH - Foreman, Puppet, Ansible & CI/CD tools - Icinga, Grafana, ELK.
Your profile : In order to succeed in your work, we expect you to have strong experience in the following areas:
- Linux (e.g. RedHat/CentOS, Ubuntu) in production server environments - Physical, virtualized and containerized infrastructure - Network concepts (e.g. IP routing, DNS, HA) - Configuration & provisioning tools (e.g. Puppet, Ansible, Foreman) - Programming and scripting (e.g. Python, Ruby, bash).
We count as advantage your possible experience with:
- Implementing / operating large-scale storage systems, filesystems and data archiving - Operating large scale, Linux-based computing hardware infrastructure - Operating data centre networks built on Ethernet or InfiniBand - Operating HPC systems and software (e.g. Slurm, cluster managers) - Architecting and implementing secure IT infrastructure - Monitoring IT infrastructure - Utilizing external cloud services - Stakeholder relationships & management.
We look for a person who would have:
- Bachelor or Master degree in computer science - or similar working experience - Detail-oriented, cautious & professional working practices - Experience managing and completing large scale IT projects - Interest to improve IT operations processes and SRE practices - Experience working in collaborative and multi-cultural environments - Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, written and oral - Proven ability to work both independently and in team-based environments - Fluent communication in English (written and spoken).
We offer :
- An internationally recognized research project using state-of-the-art HPC infrastructure - A dynamic, inter-disciplinary and international working environment - An opportunity to get your hands dirty with new technologies as they emerge - Great colleagues and excellent coffee - Modern office building in picturesque Geneva
Start date : As soon as possible Term of employment : Unlimited (CDI) Duration : CDD 1 year renewable or CDI (negotiable)Contact : Please provide your CV and also a cover letter (in English) in PDF format. Remark : Only candidates who applied through EPFL website or our partner Jobup’s website will be considered.apply online

  • A state-of-the-art HPC cluster with 1200+ nodes
  • OpenStack, OpenShift & VMware
  • Spectrum Scale (8PB), TSM, NetApp & CEPH
  • Foreman, Puppet, Ansible & CI/CD tools
  • Icinga, Grafana, ELK.
Your profile :
In order to succeed in your work, we expect you to have strong experience in the following areas:
  • Linux (e.g. RedHat/CentOS, Ubuntu) in production server environments
  • Physical, virtualized and containerized infrastructure
  • Network concepts (e.g. IP routing, DNS, HA)
  • Configuration & provisioning tools (e.g. Puppet, Ansible, Foreman)
  • Programming and scripting (e.g. Python, Ruby, bash).
We count as advantage your possible experience with:
  • Implementing / operating large-scale storage systems, filesystems and data archiving
  • Operating large scale, Linux-based computing hardware infrastructure
  • Operating data centre networks built on Ethernet or InfiniBand
  • Operating HPC systems and software (e.g. Slurm, cluster managers)
  • Architecting and implementing secure IT infrastructure
  • Monitoring IT infrastructure
  • Utilizing external cloud services
  • Stakeholder relationships & management.
We look for a person who would have:
  • Bachelor or Master degree in computer science - or similar working experience
  • Detail-oriented, cautious & professional working practices
  • Experience managing and completing large scale IT projects
  • Interest to improve IT operations processes and SRE practices
  • Experience working in collaborative and multi-cultural environments
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, written and oral
  • Proven ability to work both independently and in team-based environments
  • Fluent communication in English (written and spoken).
We offer :
  • An internationally recognized research project using state-of-the-art HPC infrastructure
  • A dynamic, inter-disciplinary and international working environment
  • An opportunity to get your hands dirty with new technologies as they emerge
  • Great colleagues and excellent coffee
  • Modern office building in picturesque Geneva
Start date :
As soon as possible Term of employment :
Unlimited (CDI) Duration :
CDD 1 year renewable or CDI (negotiable)Contact :
Please provide your CV and also a cover letter (in English) in PDF format. Remark :
Only candidates who applied through EPFL website or our partner Jobup’s website will be considered.apply online

job.title: Post-doctorant(e) en sciences du climat et données climatiques

company.name: EPFL - Ecole Polytechnique Fédérale de Lausanne

job.plaincontent:
L’Ecole polytechnique fédérale de Lausanne (EPFL), est l’un des campus universitaires les plus dynamiques en Europe et s’inscrit dans le top 20 mondial de nombreux classements académiques. L’EPFL compte près de 6'000 collaboratrices et collaborateurs qui font vivre les trois missions principales de l’Ecole : la formation, la recherche et l’innovation. Le campus de l’EPFL offre un cadre de travail exceptionnel au cœur d’une communauté de 16'000 personnes dont plus de 10'000 étudiants et 3500 chercheurs issus de 120 nationalités différentes.
Post-doctorant(e) en sciences du climat et données climatiques
Mission : Le LESO-PB est engagé depuis plusieurs années dans la recherche sur les systèmes urbains qui sont sources de phénomènes complexe. Dans ce cadre-là, vous participerez au projet BRIDGE-Discovery "Measurement and Replication of Drone-Scale Atmospheric Turbulence in a Simulator of Autonomous Flight Environments (SAFE) for Drone Certification". Ce projet vise à utiliser des mesures météorologiques effectués en milieu urbain pour mieux comprendre et modéliser les phénomènes turbulents. L’objectif est de mieux prévoir les régimes de vent pour améliorer la sécurité des vols de drones. De plus, avec les effets du changement climatique, nous voulons identifier comment les variables météorologiques évolueront à l'avenir. Principales tâches et responsabilités :
- Il vous sera demandé d'analyser un ensemble de données météorologiques (vitesse du vent, température, etc.). En particulier, vous utiliserez les mesures effectuées dans le cadre du projet MoTUS - Déterminer les modèles de turbulence les plus pertinents et définir comment ils peuvent être utilisés dans l'installation d'essai de la HES-SO Genève - Développer de nouvelles paramétrisations pour les modèles climatiques urbains en utilisant des approches basées sur les données - Réaliser des simulations climatiques pour des zones urbaines
Profil recherché :
- Doctorat en sciences de la terre, du climat ou de l'environnement (ou équivalent) - Compétences et capacités analytiques pour mener des recherches dans des domaines liés à la physique urbaine et au traitement d'ensembles de données à grande échelle - Compétences extensives à traiter des données à grande échelle - Expérience avec les langages de programmation comme Python, Fortran…
Nous offrons :
- Des ressources importantes ainsi qu’une bonne infrastructure de recherche - Salaire et avantages sociaux très compétitifs au niveau international - L'EPFL est un employeur qui respecte l'égalité des chances - Cadre de travail collégial et sympathique disposant d’une assistance administrative
Date d'entrée en fonction : Le plus tôt possible Type de contrat : Durée déterminée (CDD) Taux d'occupation : 100% Durée : 1 annéeContact : Pour postuler, veuillez envoyer les documents suivants au format PDF à recruitment.leso@epfl.ch : lettre de motivation, curriculum vitae, liste des publications, déclaration concise des intérêts en matière de recherche et d'enseignement, ainsi que noms et adresses (y compris l'adresse électronique) d'au moins trois personnes de référence, avant le 17 avril 2020. Seules les candidatures envoyées à recruitment.leso@epfl.ch seront prises en considération.
Pour de plus amples informations, veuillez contacter le Dr. Dasaraden Mauree par e-mail à dasaraden.mauree@epfl.ch

job.title: Knowledge Graph Engineer (W/M)

company.name: EPFL - Ecole Polytechnique Fédérale de Lausanne

job.plaincontent:
The Ecole polytechnique fédérale de Lausanne (EPFL) is one of the most dynamic university campuses in Europe and ranks among the top 20 universities worldwide. The EPFL employs 6,000 people supporting the three main missions of the institutions: education, research and innovation. The EPFL campus offers an exceptional working environment at the heart of a community of 16,000 people, including over 10,000 students and 3,500 researchers from 120 different countries.
Knowledge Graph Engineer (W/M)
Your mission : The EPFL Blue Brain Project (BBP), situated on the Campus Biotech in Geneva, Switzerland, applies advanced neuroinformatics, data analytics, high-performance computing and simulation-based approaches to the challenge of understanding the structure and function of the mammalian brain in health and disease. The BBP provides the community with regular releases of data, models and tools to accelerate neuroscience discovery and clinical translation through open science and global collaboration. To accelerate its scientific roadmap, BBP is building Blue Brain Nexus (https://bluebrainnexus.io), a knowledge graph system used by the BBP’s Data and Knowledge Engineering team to perform large-scale semantic and spatial (e.g. within Brain Atlases) data integration, search and analysis. To strengthen its Data and Knowledge Engineering team, BBP is looking for a: Knowledge Graph Engineer (W/M). Main duties and responsibilities include :
- In relation with data providers and consumers, develop data and knowledge structures for improving data integration and accessibility as well as enabling automated reasoning and inference within the knowledge graph - Develop pipeline to semantically represent in the knowledge graph data from different sources and of various formats. - As a team player, participate in the design and implementation of features in the Blue Brain Nexus technology stack - Implement best-practices for maintainable software development, including but not limited to: continuous integration, build, release, deployment process, managing services in various environments, documentation, adherence to and improvement of coding standards.
Your profile : Experience and preferred skills:
- Strong experience in Semantic web technologies and formats (at least: RDF, OWL, SPARQL) - Experience in building Linked Data platforms and knowledge graphs, - Experience with at least one framework for building semantic web applications: RDFLib, JenaI,... - Experience with Triple Stores (Blazegraph, Virtuoso,...) and/or Property Graphs (Neo4J,...) - Experience with at least one of the following programming languages: Python, Java, Scala, - Experience with Agile software development, unit and integration testing.
Experience in any of the following areas would be a plus:
- Lucene based search engines (ElasticSearch, Solr), - Experience with workflow management systems, - Container orchestration technologies (kubernetes, ...), - Distributed systems, - Scalable data analytics technologies (Spark).
Profile:
- Master degree in software engineering or equivalent, - At least 3 years experience of software development and/or data engineering, - English written and spoken. French would be a plus.
We offer :
- A world-recognized leader in simulation-based research in neuroscience using supercomputers - A dynamic, multidisciplinary, international and collaborative working environment committed to benefitting the global community - A modern working environment, based at the Biotech Campus in Geneva Sécheron
Start date : As soon as possible Term of employment : Fixed-term (CDD) Duration : 1 year, renewable
Remark : Only candidates who applied through EPFL website or our partner Jobup’s website will be considered.apply online

job.title: Post-Doctoral Researcher in Machine Learning

company.name: EPFL - Ecole Polytechnique Fédérale de Lausanne

job.plaincontent:
The Ecole polytechnique fédérale de Lausanne (EPFL) is one of the most dynamic university campuses in Europe and ranks among the top 20 universities worldwide. The EPFL employs 6,000 people supporting the three main missions of the institutions: education, research and innovation. The EPFL campus offers an exceptional working environment at the heart of a community of 16,000 people, including over 10,000 students and 3,500 researchers from 120 different countries.
Post-Doctoral Researcher in Machine Learning
Your mission : The EPFL Theory of Machine Learning Laboratory in Lausanne, Switzerland, headed by Prof. Nicolas Flammarion is recruiting a postdoc specialized in machine learning. Main duties and responsibilities include : Contribution to research under the TML group, and lead innovative research projects.
A non-exhaustive list of topics that are currently investigated by the team include large-scale MCMC and optimization algorithms as well as robust machine learning and statistics. Your profile : Candidates should have completed, or be near completion of, a PhD with a strong international publication record in areas such as machine learning, optimization, statistics, theoretical computer science or related fields.
When applying, please upload the following documents:
- Name of two references - 2-3 Representative publications - Research Statement (optional) We offer : EPFL ranks among the world’s top universities in computer science, and in machine learning in particular. It is located in Lausanne, Switzerland, a beautiful and vibrant city in an Alpine setting on the shores of scenic Lake Geneva, in the very heart of Europe. English is the main language spoken at EPFL, and Lausanne is highly international, such that no French language skills are required. EPFL is an equal opportunity employer. Start date : At the earliest on Oct 1, 2020 (for non-EU) Earlier dates can be discussed for CH or EU residents Term of employment : Fixed-term (CDD) Duration : 1 year, renewable Remark : Only candidates who applied through EPFL website or our partner Jobup’s website will be considered.apply online

job.title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow in Nanophotonic Devices and Integration

company.name: EPFL - Ecole Polytechnique Fédérale de Lausanne

job.plaincontent:
The Ecole polytechnique fédérale de Lausanne (EPFL) is one of the most dynamic university campuses in Europe and ranks among the top 20 universities worldwide. The EPFL employs 6,000 people supporting the three main missions of the institutions: education, research and innovation. The EPFL campus offers an exceptional working environment at the heart of a community of 16,000 people, including over 10,000 students and 3,500 researchers from 120 different countries.
Postdoctoral Research Fellow in Nanophotonic Devices and Integration
Your mission : The BioNanoPhotonic Systems (BIOS) laboratory at the Institute of BioEngineering at EPFL Switzerland, is seeking a postdoctoral research fellow to work on nanophotonic point-of-care (POC) systems. BIOS lab has world leading expertise in developing novel nanophotonic devices for cutting-edge biomedical applications by using toolkits including metasurfaces, microfluidics, nanofabrication, advanced data analysis. In addition, BIOS has strong interactions with industry to address important challenges in healthcare and environmental sciences. This project is multidisciplinary with emphasis on device integration, user interface design and data processing. The ultimate goal of the project is to combine multiple nanophotonic devices, optical and optoelectronic components to realize miniaturized POC devices using IR spectroscopy and bioimaging for bioanalytical applications. Main duties and responsibilities include :
- Developing nanophotonic systems and prototypes for infrared biosensing and imaging - Integrating nanophotonic devices and mid-infrared components into a POC device for biomolecular analysis - Creating user-friendly software interfaces - Analyzing experimental IR imaging data and vibrational fingerprints for detection and identification of mixed samples with the POC systems - Validating assembled nanotechnology-based POC systems for applications in the field
Your profile :
- Knowledge and experience in device integration, signal processing and data analysis are required. - Experience in photonics and nanotechnology are preferred. - Previous experience in system integration and/or prototype of optoelectronic and/or electronic devices - Knowledge of programming user interfaces for devices (e.g., LabVIEW, Python, or Matlab) - Experience of data analysis of spectroscopy signals from complex samples is a plus
We offer :
- Opportunity to work on cutting-edge projects for bioanalytical applications with novel nanophotonic sensors - Opportunity to interact with world-leading industry companies for technology transfer - The candidate will have the opportunity of conducting research in a top-ranked engineering school, with a young, stimulating, dynamic, interdisciplinary, and international working environment. - EPFL is an international and world-class engineering university. It offers state-of-the-art facilities, scientific events and training and hosts a vibrant entrepreneurial community. - EPFL is an equal-opportunity employer. Candidates will be recruited on merit only. - We offer a competitive salary commensurate with skills and experience, and subject to EPFL salary scale.
Please check some of the relevant recent publications from our lab :
Science 2018 , Imaging-Based Molecular Barcoding with Pixelated Dielectric Metasurfaces
Science Advances 2019 , Angle-Multiplexed All-Dielectric Metasurfaces for Broadband Molecular Fingerprint Retrieval
Nature Photonics 2019 , Ultrasensitive Hyperspectral Imaging and Biodetection Enabled by Dielectric Metasurfaces
Small 2020 , Rapid and Digital Detection of Inflammatory Biomarkers Enabled by a Novel Portable Nanoplasmonic Imager Start date : As soon as possible Term of employment : Fixed-term (CDD) Duration : 1 year, renewableContact : Please send your application with the subject line « Postdoctoral Research Fellow» to bios@epfl.ch in a single pdf file containing all the required information. It shall include a cover letter, CV, a list of publications, and contact details of three referees. Applications will be evaluated as soon as received.

job.title: Facilities Manager

company.name: EPFL - Ecole Polytechnique Fédérale de Lausanne

job.plaincontent:
L’Ecole polytechnique fédérale de Lausanne (EPFL), est l’un des campus universitaires les plus dynamiques en Europe et s’inscrit dans le top 20 mondial de nombreux classements académiques. L’EPFL compte près de 6'000 collaboratrices et collaborateurs qui font vivre les trois missions principales de l’Ecole : la formation, la recherche et l’innovation. Le campus de l’EPFL offre un cadre de travail exceptionnel au cœur d’une communauté de 16'000 personnes dont plus de 10'000 étudiants et 3500 chercheurs issus de 120 nationalités différentes.
Facilities Manager
Mission : Vos missions, sous la responsabilité directe du directeur opérationnel :
- Coordonner l’équipe de maintenance en charge des équipements scientifiques, des infrastructures et du matériel IT - Organiser les maintenances et les mises à jour et assurer le suivi journalier pour la climatisation, la distribution des médias et la récupération - Apporter une expertise pointue en matière de dépannage, d’entretien, de mises à jour et de construction - Mettre en place, former et veiller au respect des procédures pour assurer la sécurité des personnes et des biens
Principales tâches et responsabilités :
- Être responsable du bon fonctionnement des équipements de la plateforme en assurant leur maintenance, ainsi que les réparations et les dépannages dans les plus brefs délais - Etablir un plan de développement cohérent de la plateforme avec les implantations adéquates des équipements en tenant compte des spécifications particulières de chaque équipement - Coordonner et participer aux interventions, y compris avec l’appui des ingénieurs responsables des équipements, avec les différents services centraux de l’EPFL et avec les entreprises externes intervenant sur le site - Mettre en place les outils nécessaires pour l’évaluation des performances des équipements et des infrastructures. - Assurer un suivi des contrôles périodiques des infrastructures, des équipements, et de l’utilisation des salles blanches - Participer à l’évaluation de nouveaux équipements - Définir les cahiers des charges lors de la création de nouveaux locaux - Planifier en détail et gérer activement l’installation de nouveaux équipements ainsi que le démontage d’anciens matériels - Offrir un soutien technique aux autres laboratoires de l’EPFL
Profil recherché :
- Être au bénéfice d'un diplôme d'ingénieur HES ou titre jugé équivalent - Être au bénéfice d’une expérience industrielle dans le domaine des semiconducteurs et des salles à propreté contrôlée - Démontrer une capacité à gérer une équipe et à coordonner des sous-traitants - Posséder des bonnes connaissances en mécanique, électronique et optique (dépannage). - Avoir des connaissances en informatique et interfaces de communication - Être apte à gérer l’utilisation de produits chimiques ainsi que leurs déchets - Avoir des compétences dans les techniques du vide - Avoir de l’expérience dans la manipulation des cylindres de gaz actifs - Sens du dialogue et de la collaboration dans le cadre d’équipes pluridisciplinaires - Bonnes connaissances en anglais (oral et écrit) - Une bonne compréhension des procédés utilisés en MicroNanoFabrication serait un avantage - Rigueur, précision et organisation
Nous offrons :
- Une ambiance de travail conviviale et stimulante - Un environnement de travail de qualité - Une formation continue - Un travail sur des équipements industriels dans une salles blanche évolutive de clase ISO5
Date d'entrée en fonction : De suite ou à convenir Type de contrat : Durée indéterminée (CDI) Taux d'occupation : 100% Contact : Des renseignements complémentaires peuvent être obtenus auprès par e-mail à infocmi@epfl.ch. Remarque : Seuls les candidats ayant postulé via le site internet de l'EPFL ou celui de notre partenaire Jobup seront pris en compte.postuler en ligne
job.htmlcontent:
L’Ecole polytechnique fédérale de Lausanne (EPFL), est l’un des campus universitaires les plus dynamiques en Europe et s’inscrit dans le top 20 mondial de nombreux classements académiques. L’EPFL compte près de 6'000 collaboratrices et collaborateurs qui font vivre les trois missions principales de l’Ecole : la formation, la recherche et l’innovation. Le campus de l’EPFL offre un cadre de travail exceptionnel au cœur d’une communauté de 16'000 personnes dont plus de 10'000 étudiants et 3500 chercheurs issus de 120 nationalités différentes.

Facilities Manager

Mission :
Vos missions, sous la responsabilité directe du directeur opérationnel :
  • Coordonner l’équipe de maintenance en charge des équipements scientifiques, des infrastructures et du matériel IT
  • Organiser les maintenances et les mises à jour et assurer le suivi journalier pour la climatisation, la distribution des médias et la récupération
  • Apporter une expertise pointue en matière de dépannage, d’entretien, de mises à jour et de construction
  • Mettre en place, former et veiller au respect des procédures pour assurer la sécurité des personnes et des biens
Principales tâches et responsabilités :
  • Être responsable du bon fonctionnement des équipements de la plateforme en assurant leur maintenance, ainsi que les réparations et les dépannages dans les plus brefs délais
  • Etablir un plan de développement cohérent de la plateforme avec les implantations adéquates des équipements en tenant compte des spécifications particulières de chaque équipement
  • Coordonner et participer aux interventions, y compris avec l’appui des ingénieurs responsables des équipements, avec les différents services centraux de l’EPFL et avec les entreprises externes intervenant sur le site
  • Mettre en place les outils nécessaires pour l’évaluation des performances des équipements et des infrastructures.
  • Assurer un suivi des contrôles périodiques des infrastructures, des équipements, et de l’utilisation des salles blanches
  • Participer à l’évaluation de nouveaux équipements
  • Définir les cahiers des charges lors de la création de nouveaux locaux
  • Planifier en détail et gérer activement l’installation de nouveaux équipements ainsi que le démontage d’anciens matériels
  • Offrir un soutien technique aux autres laboratoires de l’EPFL
Profil recherché :
  • Être au bénéfice d'un diplôme d'ingénieur HES ou titre jugé équivalent
  • Être au bénéfice d’une expérience industrielle dans le domaine des semiconducteurs et des salles à propreté contrôlée
  • Démontrer une capacité à gérer une équipe et à coordonner des sous-traitants
  • Posséder des bonnes connaissances en mécanique, électronique et optique (dépannage).
  • Avoir des connaissances en informatique et interfaces de communication
  • Être apte à gérer l’utilisation de produits chimiques ainsi que leurs déchets
  • Avoir des compétences dans les techniques du vide
  • Avoir de l’expérience dans la manipulation des cylindres de gaz actifs
  • Sens du dialogue et de la collaboration dans le cadre d’équipes pluridisciplinaires
  • Bonnes connaissances en anglais (oral et écrit)
  • Une bonne compréhension des procédés utilisés en MicroNanoFabrication serait un avantage
  • Rigueur, précision et organisation
Nous offrons :
  • Une ambiance de travail conviviale et stimulante
  • Un environnement de travail de qualité
  • Une formation continue
  • Un travail sur des équipements industriels dans une salles blanche évolutive de clase ISO5

De suite ou à convenir Type de contrat :
Durée indéterminée (CDI) Taux d'occupation :
100% Contact :

job.title: Postdoctoral researcher in in-silico neuroscience - structure-function relation (W/M)

company.name: EPFL - Ecole Polytechnique Fédérale de Lausanne

job.plaincontent:
The Ecole polytechnique fédérale de Lausanne (EPFL) is one of the most dynamic university campuses in Europe and ranks among the top 20 universities worldwide. The EPFL employs 6,000 people supporting the three main missions of the institutions: education, research and innovation. The EPFL campus offers an exceptional working environment at the heart of a community of 16,000 people, including over 10,000 students and 3,500 researchers from 120 different countries.
Postdoctoral researcher in in-silico neuroscience – structure-function relation (W/M)
Your mission : The EPFL Blue Brain Project (BBP), situated on the Campus Biotech in Geneva, Switzerland, applies advanced neuroinformatics, data analytics, high-performance computing and simulation-based approaches to the challenge of understanding the structure and function of the mammalian brain in health and disease. The BBP provides the community with regular releases of data, models and tools to accelerate neuroscience discovery and clinical translation through open science and global collaboration. For our Connectomics team, we are currently seeking a: Postdoctoral Researcher in Simulation Neuroscience (W/M). Main duties and responsibilities include :
- Research and development of computational, analytical and simulation-based approaches, leveraging BBP in-silico models of brain regions, to investigate the representation of stimuli in neural circuits and how it depends on and is implemented by synaptic connections (i.e. the micro-connectome). - Use the BBP pipelines for simulations of voltage sensitive dye (VSD) imaging or local field potentials (LFP) to compare results from the first point to in-vitro and in-vivo data from the literature and predict how these aggregate signals depend on single neuron activity. - Validation and improvement of the BBP models of brain regions to improve their ability to address the questions above. - Carry out programming, simulations and analyses by themselves in these areas of the project - Collaborate and interact with other groups studying these questions, such as the Laboratory for topology and neuroscience at EPFL. - Representation of BBP and presentation of the scientific results in these research areas at conferences and research institutes. - Participation in the writing of articles and of other documents related to the research activities - Collaboration to the general research activities and logistic activities (safety, equipment maintenance, etc.) of the unit
Your profile :
- PhD in Neuroscience or related field - Publication record in the field, ideally related to Cortical Circuits, Connectivity & Activity - Strong expertise in programming, especially Python - Ideally experience with supercomputing systems - Strong background in data analysis and statistics
We offer :
- A world-recognized leader in simulation-based research in neuroscience - A dynamic, multidisciplinary, international and collaborative working environment committed to benefitting the global community - A modern working environment, based at the Biotech Campus in Geneva Sécheron
Start date : As soon as possible Term of employment : Fixed-term (CDD) Duration : 1 year, renewable Remark : Only candidates who applied through EPFL website or our partner Jobup’s website will be considered.apply online

  • Strong expertise in programming, especially Python

  • Strong background in data analysis and statistics

  • A dynamic, multidisciplinary, international and collaborative working environment committed to benefitting the global community

As soon as possible

1 year, renewable

job.title: Big Data Software Developer (W/M)

company.name: EPFL - Ecole Polytechnique Fédérale de Lausanne

job.plaincontent:
The Ecole polytechnique fédérale de Lausanne (EPFL) is one of the most dynamic university campuses in Europe and ranks among the top 20 universities worldwide. The EPFL employs 6,000 people supporting the three main missions of the institutions: education, research and innovation. The EPFL campus offers an exceptional working environment at the heart of a community of 16,000 people, including over 10,000 students and 3,500 researchers from 120 different countries.
Big Data Software Developer (W/M)
Your mission : The EPFL Blue Brain Project (BBP), situated on the Campus Biotech in Geneva, Switzerland, applies advanced neuroinformatics, data analytics, high-performance computing and simulation-based approaches to the challenge of understanding the structure and function of the mammalian brain in health and disease. The BBP provides the community with regular releases of data, models and tools to accelerate neuroscience discovery and clinical translation through open science and global collaboration.
We looking for a Big Data Software Developer (W/M) to strengthen its simulation and High Performance Computing team.
Main duties and responsibilities include :
- Design and develop Python and C++ based applications for building large scale neuronal circuits - Optimize application stack using libraries like MPI and big data frameworks like Apache Spark for large scale, highly parallel execution on supercomputing platforms - Integrate new software frameworks and hardware technologies by working with vendors - Technical survey of Big Data technologies available to C++/Python workflows
Your profile : Essential skills and experience required
- Strong proficiency in Python and/or C++ programming languages - Good understanding of Big Data technology such as Apache Spark, Hadoop, Dask or similar - Professional experience using UNIX/Linux operating systems - Good team player and fluent English in speech and writing
Preferred
- Good knowledge of data structures and algorithms - Experience in software development life-cycle including unit testing, version control, debugging and documentation - Experience with building data processing pipelines - Experience in using cloud technologies (e.g. AWS)
Profile
- Master’s degree in computer science and/or computer engineering with two years of experience in industry or track record in developing open source packages - Successful development track record in designing, developing and maintaining software projects - Quality-driven work ethics
We offer :
- A world-recognized leader in simulation-based research in neuroscience - A young, dynamic, multidisciplinary, international and collaborative working environment committed to benefitting the global community - A modern working environment, based at the Biotech Campus in Geneva Sécheron
Start date : As soon as possible Term of employment : Fixed-term (CDD) Duration : 1 year, renewable
Remark : Only candidates who applied through EPFL website or our partner Jobup’s website will be considered.apply online

job.title: Data Science Engineer (W/M)

company.name: EPFL - Ecole Polytechnique Fédérale de Lausanne

job.plaincontent:
The Ecole polytechnique fédérale de Lausanne (EPFL) is one of the most dynamic university campuses in Europe and ranks among the top 20 universities worldwide. The EPFL employs 6,000 people supporting the three main missions of the institutions: education, research and innovation. The EPFL campus offers an exceptional working environment at the heart of a community of 16,000 people, including over 10,000 students and 3,500 researchers from 120 different countries.
Data Science Engineer (W/M)
Your mission : EPFL and ETH Zurich are seeking enthusiastic and experienced candidates with scientific IT expertise and a proven track record in and around data science and analytics on large-scale distributed platforms, services and applications, to staff up their national R&D Swiss Data Science Center. The ideal candidate will become part of the Swiss Data Science Center and will act as an enabler of data science activities within the research community from the ETH domains, Swiss universities, and the industry. In this role, you will:
- liaise with data providers, data scientists, domain scientists, and industry partners, - understand goals, gather requirements, implement solutions, - ensure knowledge transfer between stakeholders.
Main duties and responsibilities include :
- Liaise with data providers, data scientists, domain scientists, and industry partners to gather requirements. - Design, develop and set up novel (big) data science solutions into industrial and academic environments, using state of the art data science frameworks - Prepare tutorials, presentations, blogs, publications, about data science technologies. - Provide trainings and promote the technology and services offered by the SDSC, in particular in connection with the Renku platform (https://renkulab.io/)
Your profile :
- A bachelor’s degree (MSc or higher preferred) in computer science or a related discipline (e.g., statistics, bioinformatics, physics, or electrical engineering) - A proven track record of crafting innovative and elegant software solutions, and a good command of the Python programming language. Familiarity with another programming/scripting language, especially R, is a strong plus. - Previous experience applying machine learning and (big) data analytics frameworks such as TensorFlow, Pytorch, Scikit-learn, Tidymodels, and the Apache Hadoop ecosystem, to real world problems. - Familiarity with software development best practices, such as agile software development and CI/CD, and tools like Git as well. - Consistent experience with the Linux operating system. Experience with cloud technology, and containers like Docker or Kubernetes, are highly desirable. - Ability to work well in a cross-functional environment and excel in communicating with your peers. - An interest to explore and learn novel technologies and put them to practice in uncharted territories. - Excellent command of the English language, both verbal and written (required). Good working knowledge of French or German, would be a plus.
About the Swiss Data Science Center (SDSC) The Swiss Data Science Center (SDSC, datascience.ch) is a national center between EPFL and ETH Zurich, whose mission is to accelerate the use of data science and machine learning techniques broadly within academic disciplines of the ETH Domain and the Swiss academic community at large. It aims to federate data providers, data and computer scientists, and subject-matter experts around a cutting-edge analytics platform offering domain-specific “Insights-as-a-Service” while addressing security and privacy issues inherent to the field of data science. The SDSC is composed of a large multi-disciplinary team of data & computer scientists and experts in relevant domains, distributed between our offices in Lausanne and Zurich. The unique synergy that the center enables among the institutions of the ETH Domain and between academic and industrial stakeholders in both data science and across carefully selected domains is expected to foster scientific breakthroughs with significant societal impact. About Renku Many data science projects today struggle to be efficient. It is difficult to identify available data, and then even more to share it; those who share data are often not recognized for their contribution; it is a struggle to keep track of versions of data; it is hard to see what code and data were used by whom to produce what results. Renku (https://datascience.ch/renku/, https://renkulab.io/) is an open platform developed by SDSC to address these problems. Renku supports versioning of data and code; Renku tracks which results were produced by whom and when. Renku makes it possible to have greater trust in results and acknowledge the contributions of all those involved, regardless of whether their contribution was to implement the solution, provide the data, or ask the right questions. Applications via email or postal services will not be considered. For further information about the Swiss Data Science Center please visit our website:www.datascience.ch. Questions regarding the position should be directed to Christine Choirat (christine.choirat@datascience.ch) (no applications). We offer : We offer you a stimulating, startup-like, cross-disciplinary environment in a world-class research center that is part of two leading universities. In this dynamic position, you will make full use of your data science engineering and research skills and creativity to develop novel solutions for real cutting-edge questions. You will design user interfaces, contribute to decision-making about the direction of the SDSC platforms and investigate available technology options. You will work in a data science setting alongside leading domain and computer science experts from the ETH domain as well as industry. We have excellent ties to research groups worldwide, both academic and industrial. You will get access to state-of-the-art infrastructure and resources. Start date : As soon as possible Term of employment : Fixed-term (CDD) Duration : CDD 1 year, renewable Remark : Only candidates who applied through EPFL website or our partner Jobup’s website will be considered.apply online

job.title: Physical Limnology - Postdoctoral Researcher

company.name: EPFL - Ecole Polytechnique Fédérale de Lausanne

job.plaincontent:
The Ecole polytechnique fédérale de Lausanne (EPFL) is one of the most dynamic university campuses in Europe and ranks among the top 20 universities worldwide. The EPFL employs 6,000 people supporting the three main missions of the institutions: education, research and innovation. The EPFL campus offers an exceptional working environment at the heart of a community of 16,000 people, including over 10,000 students and 3,500 researchers from 120 different countries.
Physical Limnology - Postdoctoral Researcher
Your mission : The Ecological Engineering Laboratory (ECOL, https://www.epfl.ch/labs/ecol/) is active in the study of physical lake processes.
We wish to extend and reinforce our various projects, in particular our present field work that includes the investigation of winter cooling, river inflow, and air-water exchange. All fieldwork is complemented by 3D numerical modelling of lake hydrodynamics. Main duties and responsibilities include : We seek a motivated postdoc with experience in designing and carrying out independent field campaigns and capable of operating our state-of-the-art remote sensing and fine-scale measurement instruments and equipment. Your profile :
- PhD degree in physical limnology, oceanography or environmental fluid mechanics, including (extensive) field experience - Advanced competencies in large data set analysis and a strong publication record - Proficient in English, French is an asset
To be considered complete, a candidate's application should include the following documents:
- Cover letter / motivation letter - CV / resume - Doctoral diploma (alternatively an official note from the current institution stating the date when the doctoral degree is expected) - Research statement (up to 3 pages) - Contact Information of 3 references (a single PDF file containing the names, affiliations, and email addresses of 3 references)
We offer : EPFL ranks among the world’s top scientific universities. It is located in Lausanne, Switzerland, a beautiful and vibrant city on the shores of scenic Lake Geneva, situated within an Alpine setting in the heart of Europe.
The position comes with a competitive salary that allows for comfortable living conditions in the Lausanne area. EPFL is committed to being an equal opportunity employer. Start date : As soon as a suitable candidate is found - the position is open until filled Term of employment : Fixed-term (CDD) Work rate : 100% Duration : Fixed-term contract, two years Contact : Contact Prof. D. Andrew Barry (andrew.barry@epfl.ch) with your application letter and complete CV.
